verbose_text: Finally, we assessed whether the observed increase in heat sensitivity was based on a direct activation of nociceptors via S1P 1 or S1P 3 receptors in two different transgenic mouse strains, either lacking S1P 1 in Nav1.8 expressing nociceptive neurons (SNS-S1P 1 -/-) or with a global null mutation for S1P 3, and whether neutralization of S1P in the platelet preparations, as published previously in a different model, prevented the development of heat hypersensitivity upon platelet injection.
